{"step_by_step_thinking": "The quick SOFA (qSOFA) score is a simplified version of the SOFA score used to identify patients at high risk for poor outcome with an infection. According to Document [0], the qSOFA includes three clinical criteria: respiratory rate, altered mentation, and systolic blood pressure. Therefore, the component that is not part of the qSOFA scoring is bilateral undilated pupils.", "answer_choice": "A"}
